column1: Pentobarbital is a sedative, which is a medicine that makes you sleepy.
Pentobarbital is the generic name for the following medicines: - Nembutal - Pentosol - Repocal - Sopental

Symptoms of a pentobarbital overdose may include: - Coma - Confusion - Decreased energy - Delirium (confusion and agitation) - Difficulty breathing - Headache - Large blisters - Rash - Sleepiness - Slowed or stopped breathing - Slurred speech - Unsteady gait

The person may receive: - Activated charcoal - Airway support, including oxygen, breathing tube through the mouth (intubation), and breathing machine (ventilator) - Blood and urine tests - Chest x-ray - EKG (electrocardiogram, or heart tracing) - Fluids through a vein (IV) - Laxative - Medicines to treat symptoms People who still have symptoms after 6 hours of treatment may need to be admitted to the hospital.
